name: St. Mesrob

locations.description: Created Armenian alphabet, translated Bible into Armenian

summary: Mesrob, also known as Mesrop Mashtots, was an Armenian monk and linguist who created the Armenian alphabet around 405 AD. This was crucial for the development of Armenian Christianity, as it allowed the Bible and liturgical texts to be translated into Armenian. He also created alphabets for Georgian and Caucasian Albanian. He is venerated as a saint and is considered one of the most important figures in Armenian cultural and religious history.
